thread.title: MSU basketball sneak preview set for Oct. 17
thread.title_full: MSU basketball sneak preview set for Oct. 17

title: MSU basketball sneak preview set for Oct. 17
text: Posted : Wednesday, 07 October 2015 4:59PM MSU basketball sneak preview set for Oct. 17 Ben Adamson Reporting MSU Sports Information SPRINGFIELD, Mo. -- The list of athletic events scheduled for Missouri State University’s homecoming weekend, October 16-18, continues to grow with the finalization Tuesday of plans for the annual men’s and women’s basketball sneak preview event on Saturday, Oct. 17. MSU fans’ first look at the Bears and Lady Bears will take place at JQH Arena, starting at 5:30 p.m. Admission for the event is free, and gates open at 5 p.m. Standard arena amenities will be available, and parking is available on a first-come, first-served basis at adjacent parking lots and facilities. Both teams will conduct 30-minute intrasquad scrimmages, starting with Lady Bears’ warm-up and introductions by coach Kellie Harper at 5:30 p.m. Harper, who will be mic’d up for the women’s scrimmage, will also lead fan interaction and games during the women’s warm-up. The men’s team will be signing autographs on the west end of the arena during the women’s scrimmage. The Bears will take the floor at approximately 6:15 for warmups with coach Paul Lusk introducing his players and addressing fans in attendance. The women’s team will sign autographs and meet fans during the men’s intrasquad scrimmage portion of the event, which will conclude at 7 p.m. Schedule cards, posters and other fan items will also be distributed at the scrimmage. All fans in attendance for the basketball sneak preview will receive a free admission voucher for that evening’s MSU volleyball match, which will feature the Bears against visiting Bradley University at 7 p.m., at Hammons Student Center. For men’s and women’s season ticket information, please contact Duane Miller at (417) 836-8899. Single-game tickets for all non-conference home games go on sale on Monday, Oct. 12 at 9 a.m. at MissouriStateBears.com/tickets, by phone at (417) 836-7678 or in person at the JQH Arena box office. Tickets for all conference games will be available to the public via the same ticket outlets on Monday, Nov. 30. 2015 Homecoming Weekend Athletic Events Friday, October 16 Swimming & Diving vs. Drury, Hammons Student Center, 6 p.m. Volleyball vs. Loyola Chicago, Hammons Student Center, 7 p.m. Saturday, October 17 Football vs. Illinois State, Robert W. Plaster Stadium, 2 p.m. [ Tickets ] Swimming & Diving vs. Alumni, Hammons Student Center, 4 p.m. Men’s & Women’s Basketball Sneak Preview Event, JQH Arena, 5:30 p.m. Women’s Soccer vs. Illinois State, Betty & Bobby Allison South Stadium, 6 p.m. Volleyball vs. Bradley, Hammons Student Center, 7 p.m.
